text: {| class="wikitable floatright" style="font-size: 0.9em;" |+ Minor planets discovered: 2 |- | || 16 May 1999 || |- | || 26 November 2000 || |- ! colspan=3 style="font-weight: normal; text-align: left; padding: 4px 12px;" | with O. R. Hainaut with C. E. Delahodde |} Audrey Delsanti (; born 27 August 1976) is a French astronomer and a discoverer of minor planets at ESO's La Silla Observatory in Chile. The Minor Planet Center credits her with the discovery of two numbered minor planets, but erroneously gives the credit to "A. Dalsanti" for the trans-Neptunian object , which she co-discovered in 1999. In 2004 she was awarded a NASA Postdoctoral Fellowship in astrobiology at the Institute for Astronomy of the University of Hawaii in Honolulu. == References == == External links == * Audrey Delsanti – Homepage Category:French astronomers Category:Astrobiologists Category:Planetary scientists Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Discoverers of trans-Neptunian objects Category:French women biologists Category:Women astronomers Category:20th- century French scientists Category:21st-century French scientists Category:20th-century French women scientists Category:21st-century French women scientists Category:20th-century astronomers Category:21st-century astronomers Category:Women planetary scientists
title: Audrey C. Delsanti
